project.name: Hera QA Platform
project.scope: Unified test orchestration, flaky test analytics

sections.title: Context & Role
sections.goal: Understand the QA Lead's role in Hera QA Platform and how it aligns with company values and policies.
sample_questions: Can you walk me through your responsibilities on the Hera QA Platform project?
How do you see the company's values, like 'Evidence over Hype' or 'Risk-Based Testing & Traceability', influencing your day-to-day work?
What are the main deliverables you own in the Build phase?

sections.title: Testing Strategy & Orchestration
sections.goal: Explore the risk-based testing approach, orchestration tools, and traceability mechanisms used in the project.
sample_questions: Could you describe how RFC-1770 Risk-based Test Selection has been implemented?
What orchestration tools or frameworks are you using for test execution and reporting?
How do you ensure traceability from requirements to test cases and defects?

sections.title: Flaky Test Analytics
sections.goal: Dive into the methods for detecting, analyzing, and mitigating flaky tests across multiple subsystems.
sample_questions: What metrics or signals do you rely on to classify a test as flaky?
Can you give an example of how flaky test analytics influenced a release decision?
How do you balance automated detection with manual investigation?

sections.title: Cross-Project Dependencies
sections.goal: Understand how QA processes in Hera integrate with other projects like Helios Datalake or Orion Edge Gateway.
sample_questions: Are there shared test data or environments between Hera and other projects?
How do you coordinate with teams from P-HEL or P-ORI when integration points are impacted?
Could you walk me through a case where a defect in another project affected Hera's QA pipeline?

sections.title: Decision-Making & Risk Management
sections.goal: Discuss trade-offs, risk acceptance, and evidence-based decisions, referencing runbooks, SLAs, or tickets.
sample_questions: Can you recall a decision where you had to accept a known risk before release?
What evidence did you collect to support that decision?
How do you document and communicate such trade-offs to stakeholders?

sections.title: Future Improvements & UX Alignment

sample_questions: From a UX standpoint, what parts of the QA tooling are most frustrating for your team?
If you could redesign one aspect of the test orchestration interface, what would it be?
How can improved UX in QA tools impact the reliability and speed of testing?
